At 11:44 AM 23/05/01, you wrote:
>Jim Cheesman <jchees@...> wrote:
>
> > On the other hand...  I have the test classes in the same package as
> > the classes to test, and then use delete/fileset/include in ant when
> > packaging.
>
>Or simply put your test classes in the same package but a different
>directory - so you don't have to delete anything.  Ant does so for its
>testcases for example.



If you compile to a seperate directory won't the classes all be dumped in 
the same place? I realise that your way of doing it helps seperate/manage 
the source files, but does it work once compiled?
